TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlDsigXPathTransform extends System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform

Docs.summary: Represents the XPath transform for a digital signature as defined by the W3C.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The XmlDsigXPathTransform class allows you to address an XML document using the XPath language. This class uses an XPath expression to select the XML nodes you want to sign or encrypt while removing all others from either cryptographic operation.
Use the XmlDsigXPathTransform class to sign or encrypt specific parts of an XML document using an XPath expression. For information on initializing the XmlDsigXPathTransform class to the value of an XPath transform string, see the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.LoadInnerXml%2A> method.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that describes the XmlDsigXPathTransform class is defined by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigXPathTransformUrl> field.
For more information about the XPath transform, see Section 6.6.3 of the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
## Examples This section contains two code examples. The first code example shows how to sign and verify an XML document using the XmlDsigXPathTransform class with an envelope signature. This example signs an XML document and saves the signature in a new XML document. The second code example demonstrates how to call members of the XmlDsigXPathTransform class.
**Example #1**

Docs.summary: Returns an XML representation of the parameters of a object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG element.
Docs.returns: A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current object in an XMLDSIG element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetOutput() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the output of the current object.
Docs.returns: The output of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The type of the returned object must be <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.
Use the GetOutput method to retrieve a <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> object that contains an XML representation of an XPath transform.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the GetOutput method to retrieve the output of the current <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> object. Docs.summary: Gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.LoadInput%2A> method of the current object.
Docs.value: An array of valid input types for the current object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.LoadInput%2A> method of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The valid input types to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> are <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, and <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the InputTypes property to retrieve the valid input types for the current transform. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void LoadInnerXml(class System.Xml.XmlNodeList nodeList) cil managed

Docs.param: An object to load into the current object.
Docs.summary: Parses the specified object as transform-specific content of a element and configures the internal state of the current object to match the element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the LoadInnerXml method to initialize the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class with an XPath transform.
To initialize the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class with an XPath transform, complete the following steps.
1. Create a new <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> class and set the <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement.InnerText%2A> property to the value of an XPath transform string.
2. Call the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.SelectNodes%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> object that represents the transform.
3. Create a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class and pass the previously created <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> object to the LoadInnerXml method.
## Examples The following code example shows how to sign and verify an XML document using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class. This sample creates an envelope signature.
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e002fc43-4db1-44f5-9eb6-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e002fc43-4db1-44f5-9eb6-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e002fc43-4db1-44f5-9eb6-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void LoadInput(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The input to load into the current object.
Docs.summary: Loads the specified input into the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the LoadInput method to initialize an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> object to the value of an XPath transform using an <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> object. For information about initializing an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> object using an XPath transform string, see the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.LoadInnerXml%2A> method.
The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.InputTypes%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the LoadInput method using the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument> object as the input. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class.
[!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/b18c6d2e-042c-42b7-b168-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/b18c6d2e-042c-42b7-b168-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets an array of types that are possible outputs from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.GetOutput%2A> methods of the current object.
Docs.value: An array of valid output types for the current object; the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform.GetOutput%2A> methods of the current object return only objects of one of these types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> is the only valid output type for <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to call the OutputTypes property to retrieve the valid output types for the current transform. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform> class.
[!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_101_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.XmlDsigXPathTransform#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_101_1.cs)]
